meanings.sent1: The teacher will penalise students who do not complete their homework.
meanings.sent2: It is important to penalise those who break the rules to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: If you don't clean your room, I will have to penalise you with extra chores.
meanings.sent4: The referee decided to penalise the player for his rough behavior on the field.
meanings.sent5: Failure to follow the guidelines will result in the company having to penalise employees.

meanings.definition: to subject to a penalty or punishment
meanings.sent1: The court may penalise individuals who commit crimes with fines or jail time.
meanings.sent2: Countries have laws in place to penalise those who engage in illegal activities.
meanings.sent3: If you keep eating cookies before dinner, I will have to penalise you by taking them away.
meanings.sent4: The strict coach will penalise any player who shows a lack of discipline during practice.
meanings.sent5: Parents often penalise their children by restricting screen time as a form of discipline.
